projects.name: Envoy
projects.description: Developed Envoy (a Mac-native proprietary asset tracking system) to audit and manage 750+ client computers. Envoy sends in regular reports; lets users submit support requests; integrates with DeepTech’s remote access software; keeps itself up-to-date; and can be remotely reconfigured or uninstalled. Ongoing.

projects.name: Technician tools
projects.description: Frontend and backend development on web system used by technicians for asset tracking, case managment, and scheduling. Talks to Envoy, PBX, remote access system, CalDAV calendars, and vendor APIs. Ongoing.

projects.name: Hans Haacke: News
projects.description: Built a news extraction engine in Node.js based on [Readability](http://lab.arc90.com/experiments/readability/), powering Hans Haacke’s “News” piece. Displayed in [“The Last Newspaper”](http://www.newmuseum.org/exhibitions/428) at the The New Museum, now in [SFMOMA’s permanent collection](http://www.sfmoma.org/explore/collection/artwork/126255).

projects.name: Technical service and support
projects.description: Served on DeepTech’s Mac and network support team fixing problems over the phone, via remote access, and on site. (Emergencies only, lately.)

projects.name: Reverse engineering
projects.description: Reconstructed C code from an x86 executable.

projects.name: Forensics
projects.description: Worked with the NYPD to recover data contributing to a criminal investigation.

projects.name: Debugging
projects.description:
Reduce and report bugs in third-party software on a regular basis. Not afraid to go to the source (tracked a recent jQuery performance oddity back to its cause inside WebKit).

Credited for security issues in Mac OS and iOS ([CVE-2010-0537](http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-0537), [CVE-2010-1754](http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-1754)).

projects.name: Answering questions
projects.description: Enjoy helping other programmers, in the top 10% [on Stack Overflow](http://stackoverflow.com/users/84745/sidnicious) for HTML- and JavaScript-related questions.

projects.name: Hack Club
projects.description: Lead programmer on a team of three, built an autonomous lego robot in twelve solid hours at NYC’s first (and so far, only) Hack Club run by Reddit-cofounder Alexis Ohanian. [Won fame and fortune](http://breadpig.com/2011/01/18/hack-club-1-total-success/).

projects.name: FIRST Team 555
projects.description: Lead programmer (2005-2007). Built competition robots which won regional championships and earned awards at regional and international levels.

projects.name: Git commit message formatting
projects.description: Right now, [Git](http://git-scm.com/) makes its users pre-format their commit messages (conventinally, by breaking each line at around 72-characters). Working on giving Git the ability to format commit messages when you view them instead.

projects.name: Hacker School
projects.description: Attending batch[2] of [Hacker School](http://www.hackerschool.com/), a three-month, full time retreat where good programmers become better programmers together.
